intro: Orthosiphon pseudornatus, commonly known as the Malabar bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The leaves and flowers are used in traditional medicine for their purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
